page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The area of the survey includes the township of Church and parts of Oswaldtwistle and Accrington and is situated on the northern edge of the Rossendale Forest. Church and Oswaldtwistle are ancient settlements and written evidence of their existence goes back to the l3th century. Originally a very small farming settlement it became involved in wool and weaving during Tudor Times. In the Elizabethan Times the townships were still very small with only 227 inhabitants. In the l8th century development was rapid owing to the techinical achievements of local inventor James Hargreaves and the business drive of the Peel family. James Hargreaves was born at Stanhill within Oswaldtwistle in 1720
